data.enText: the authority to do sth, given to a government or other organization by the people who vote for it in an election
data.chText: （政府或组织等经选举而获得的）授权

data.enText: The election victory gave the party a clear mandate to continue its programme of reform.
data.chText: 选举获胜使得这个政党拥有了明确的继续推行改革的权力。

data.enText: a mandate for an end to the civil war
the period of time for which a government is given power
The presidential mandate is limited to two terms of four years each.
data.chText: 总统的任期不得超过两届，每届四年。

data.enText: an official order given to sb to perform a particular task
The bank had no mandate to honour the cheque.
data.chText: 银行没有得到指令来承兑这张支票。

data.enText: the power given to a country to govern another country or region, especially in the past
data.chText: （尤指旧时授予某国对别国或地区的）委任统治权

data.enText: to order sb to behave, do sth or vote in a particular way
The law mandates that imported goods be identified as such.
data.chText: 法律规定进口货物必须如实标明。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: to give sb, especially a government or a committee, the authority to do sth

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: The assembly was mandated to draft a constitution.
data.chText: 大会被授权起草一份章程。

means: (政府或组织等经选举而获得的)授权

tr: the commission that is given to a government and its policies through an electoral victory
a document giving an official instruction or command
a territory surrendered by Turkey or Germany after World War I and put under the tutelage of some other European power until they are able to stand by themselves

example: the new director of the school board mandated regular tests

example.ex: The President and his supporters are almost certain to read this vote as a mandate for continued economic reform...
example.tran: 总统及其支持者几乎肯定地认为这次投票是对继续进行经济改革的授权。

example.ex: The union already has a mandate from its conference to ballot for a strike .
example.tran: 工会已经得到大会的授权为罢工进行投票。

value.def: If a government or other elected body has a mandate to carry out a particular policy or task, they have the authority to carry it out as a result of winning an election or vote.
value.tran: (政府或经选举组建的机构的)授权，委托

example.ex: How much longer does the independent prosecutor have a mandate to pursue this investigation?...
example.tran: 独立检察官受命调查这件事还要多长时间？

example.ex: A mandate from the UN would be needed before any plans could be implemented.
example.tran: 执行任何计划都需要联合国的授权。

value.def: If someone is given a mandate to carry out a particular policy or task, they are given the official authority to do it.

example.ex: ...his intention to leave politics once his mandate ends.
example.tran: 他关于任期一满就离开政界的打算。

value.def: You can refer to the fixed length of time that a country's leader or government remains in office as their mandate .

example.ex: He'd been mandated by the West African Economic Community to go in and to enforce a ceasefire...
example.tran: 他受西非经济共同体的委托介入并执行停火协定。

example.ex: The elections are mandated by a peace accord signed by the government last May.
example.tran: 选举是在去年5月政府签署的和平协议的授权下进行的。

value.def: When someone is mandated to carry out a particular policy or task, they are given the official authority to do it.

example.ex: The proposed initiative would mandate a reduction of carbon dioxide of 40%...
example.tran: 倡议将强制规定把二氧化碳排放量降低40%。

example.ex: Quebec mandated that all immigrants send their children to French schools.
example.tran: 魁北克省颁布法令，强制所有移民将子女送进法语学校就读。

value.def: To mandate something means to make it mandatory.
